abstract.p: Todd Zeile says he could not believe his sixth-inning drive in Game 1 of World Series that bounced off top of left-field wall and stayed in play (S)

block.p: Todd Zeile could not believe his sixth-inning drive in Game 1 on Saturday bounced off the top of the left-field wall and stayed in play. Zeile pumped his fist as if he had homered before realizing that the ball did not go out. He got a double, but Timo Perez was thrown out trying to score from first base after slowing down near second base. Zeile could not help but recall another infamous moment in Stadium history.
''Where was Jeffrey Maier when you need him?'' Zeile said.

Zeile played for the Orioles when Maier, then 12, reached over the right-field wall and turned a deep fly into a homer in the 1996 American League Championship Series.
